segments.text: I see the woman drying dishes, completely unaware of the chaos around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The sink is overflowing, and water is pouring onto the floor, but she doesn’t even notice.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her foot is already in the puddle, yet she keeps polishing that plate like nothing is wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she’s just that focused or if she’s ignoring the mess on purpose.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are being sneaky, and she has no idea.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how oblivious she is to everything happening right behind her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is spreading, and soon the whole floor will be a slippery hazard.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope someone turns off the faucet before it gets worse.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is about to fall, and she’s just standing there, drying dishes.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This is such a strange scene—so much is going wrong, and no one seems to care.
segments.speaker: PAR
